question.title: Spring boot shutdown after few seconds without notification
question.body:
I create very simple new Spring boot project. Then I run it in 3 ways:

  1. use Debug/Run button of Intellij Idea
  2. use mvn spring-boot:run
  3. use java -jar ... .jar

My application still running (can receive some request and return 200 OK). But after few seconds. It stopped without reasons.

When run in Debug mode, I can only see:

 :: Spring Boot ::                (v3.5.6)

2025-09-29T12:11:06.641+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] com.example.demo.Demo1Application        : Starting Demo1Application using Java 17.0.12 with PID 126016 (D:\CODE\NEXUSTI\demo1\target\classes started by cuong in D:\CODE\NEXUSTI\demo1)
2025-09-29T12:11:06.645+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] com.example.demo.Demo1Application        : No active profile set, falling back to 1 default profile: "default"
2025-09-29T12:11:07.008+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] o.s.b.w.embedded.tomcat.TomcatWebServer  : Tomcat initialized with port 8080 (http)
2025-09-29T12:11:07.014+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] o.apache.catalina.core.StandardService   : Starting service [Tomcat]
2025-09-29T12:11:07.014+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] o.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngine    : Starting Servlet engine: [Apache Tomcat/10.1.46]
2025-09-29T12:11:07.035+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] o.a.c.c.C.[Tomcat].[localhost].[/]       : Initializing Spring embedded WebApplicationContext
2025-09-29T12:11:07.036+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] w.s.c.ServletWebServerApplicationContext : Root WebApplicationContext: initialization completed in 363 ms
2025-09-29T12:11:07.194+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] o.s.b.w.embedded.tomcat.TomcatWebServer  : Tomcat started on port 8080 (http) with context path '/'
2025-09-29T12:11:07.199+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] com.example.demo.Demo1Application        : Started Demo1Application in 0.785 seconds (process running for 1.134)
Disconnected from the target VM, address: '127.0.0.1:50325', transport: 'socket'

Process finished with exit code -1

Project Structured:

A very simple project contains 1 class only:

package com.example.demo;

import org.springframework.boot.SpringApplication;
import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.GetMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RequestMapping;
import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.RestController;

@SpringBootApplication
@RestController
@RequestMapping
public class Demo1Application {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        SpringApplication.run(Demo1Application.class, args);
    }

    @GetMapping
    public String hello() {
        return "Hello World!";
    }
}

pom.xml

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 https://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <parent>
        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
        <version>3.5.6</version>
        <relativePath/> <!-- lookup parent from repository -->
    </parent>
    <groupId>com.example</groupId>
    <artifactId>demo1</artifactId>
    <version>0.0.1-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <name>demo1</name>
    <description>demo1</description>
    <url/>
    <licenses>
        <license/>
    </licenses>
    <developers>
        <developer/>
    </developers>
    <scm>
        <connection/>
        <developerConnection/>
        <tag/>
        <url/>
    </scm>
    <properties>
        <java.version>17</java.version>
        <maven.compiler.source>17</maven.compiler.source>
        <maven.compiler.target>17</maven.compiler.target>
    </properties>
    <dependencies>
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-web</artifactId>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
            <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-test</artifactId>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
                <artifactId>spring-boot-maven-plugin</artifactId>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>

</project>

Note that: I can send few requests before Application shutdown. And the Application can shut down any when it wants, for example:

2025-09-29T12:11:06.641+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] com.example.demo.Demo1Application        : Starting Demo1Application using Java 17.0.12 with PID 126016 (D:\CODE\NEXUSTI\demo1\target\classes started by cuong in D:\CODE\NEXUSTI\demo1)
2025-09-29T12:11:06.645+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] com.example.demo.Demo1Application        : No active profile set, falling back to 1 default profile: "default"
2025-09-29T12:11:07.008+07:00  INFO 126016 --- [demo1] [           main] o.s.b.w.embedded.tomcat.TomcatWebServer  : Tomcat initialized with port 8080 (http)

Disconnected from the target VM, address: '127.0.0.1:50325', transport: 'socket'

Process finished with exit code -1

Update: Main Cause

After a long time using the computer, I found out that there is an application installed with administrator rights, and if I don't open the application, it's fine (restart the computer)

If I run that application, maven will build error, the application will also stop with the above error.

It seems that the main cause is that application, but I still don't understand why that application causes the error (effects to JVM, effects to maven)

question_comments.body: @ArnaultLePrévost-Corvellec, it still fails, it is not port related and if there is a port related error then Spring should report that the port is duplicated at runtime.

Probably a port conflict whith your application the system dislike port concurrence and can shoot the processus change in your propertie the server port to some thing exotic like 48080 and check if the issue persist 😀

After a long time using the computer, I found out that there is an application installed with administrator rights, and if I don't open the application, it's fine (restart the computer)  If I run that application, maven will build error, the application will also stop with the above error.  It seems that the main cause is that application, but I still don't understand why that application causes the error (effects to JVM, effects to maven)

Have you look for a hs_err_pid*.log where you have run java ? If it was not kill by an external process you can have the error in it.  You can define the location of the file with the following argument when you run your program : -XX:ErrorFile=/var/log/java/hs_err_pid%p.log
Enable debug or trace logging and check what is happening.
